events.title: Sale of GM Building for $1.4 billion
events.description: Trump and partners sell the General Motors Building in Manhattan to Harry Macklowe's group for $1.4 billion, then the highest price paid for a U.S. office building. Trump's share yields hundreds of millions in profit.

moneyFlow.description: Trump and partners sold the General Motors Building in Manhattan to Harry Macklowe's group for $1.4 billion. Trump's exact share is not precisely documented but estimated to be hundreds of millions in profit. This was the highest price ever paid for a U.S. office building at the time.

entity-001.name: Donald J. Trump
entity-001.description: Real estate developer and businessman. In 2003, sold the GM Building in Manhattan with partners for a record $1.4 billion, generating substantial profit and further enhancing his reputation as a successful dealmaker.

entity-037.name: Harry Macklowe
entity-037.description: Real estate developer who purchased the GM Building from Trump and partners in 2003 for $1.4 billion, then a record price for a U.S. office building.

relationships.description: Trump and partners sold the GM Building to Harry Macklowe's group for $1.4 billion in 2003.

transactions.description: Sale of the General Motors Building in Manhattan to Harry Macklowe's group for $1.4 billion, with Trump receiving a significant portion as a partner in the selling entity.
transactions.notes: This was the highest price ever paid for a U.S. office building at the time.
